review_title: Looking to work for a woke company who only cares about their bottom line?  Look no further.
pros:
Great experiences
Great patients
Work alongside experienced providers and staff with interesting backgrounds and knowledge
cons:
Management is all about the bottom dollar (nothing new or different than anywhere else) but they would be appreciated more if they quit flaunting it.
It is a community health center, not Hollywood, management should quit thinking they are above everyone else, having an attitude of elitism and haughtiness and looking down their nose at those that work for them.
Would be nice if they stayed off of tik tok dance videos, news and politics and focused on serving the community. Many of us would appreciate less emails about the CEO's thoughts on how we rated on tik tok covid dances, election results and police situations, and instead focused on how best to serve our underserved chronically ill patients that haven't been in for over a year.

pros: Good benefits and coworkers / family environment
cons: There is no work/life balance

review_title: No longer caring for Community Health
job_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Fredericksburg, VA
pros: The center has relatively good benefits.
cons: This organization is supposed to be non-profit, but is cutting corners to increase revenue so that the upper management can have bigger bonuses. Very little trickles down to the average worker. Providers have much less time with clients. Every thing discussed is about revenue. The community health center has had good financial for at least 15 years, including during the pandemic. Senseless waste of good talent.

review_title: Excellent company mission but poor management and execution
pros: El Rio has very low expectations from its employees, so for the majority of departments, its an easy place to work.  In addition, El Rio has a small business, almost a family atmosphere in most departments, so most areas are fun to work in.  El Rio has an excellent mission, that is to provide healthcare to everyone, even for free.  This makes it a great place to feel good about what you are doing.
cons: The senior leadership at El Rio is extremely lacking.  There is no drive for results, as they do not want to drive for results themselves.  There is a complete lack of respect for their peers (and their ability to work together shows it) and in general, almost a complete lack of respect for staff.  There is almost no communication, very little training/education (El Rio has a HIGH turnover, so they feel they are training people just to leave).  The majority of leadership has never worked anywhere else, so they guard their areas and shut out new views or additional help, and trust almost no one.  Every year, employee feedback goes without being addressed, as everyone reports leadership is the root cause.

pros: Making a difference to those patients in need (low socioeconomic population)
cons: Allowing nurse managers to bully and intimidate employees even the providers!!!

review_title: My experience at El Rio was a learning one , that was an entry level job and I learned a lot about maintenance, I was t
pros: You get to meet great people and they will teach you as you go, like on the job training and since I pick up quick it was to my advantage to go to school and try to learn more about the trade, I when to Pima Community college to become a HVAC Technician I need 12 more credits to get my certificate.
cons: Learning what to do and when to do it, learning how to fill out a work order and how to go about fixing what needed to be fix, and ordering parts, receiving and keeping track of all materials.

pros: When I first began working for El Rio over 25 years ago, this clinic really cared about helping the community and supporting their staff. But as time went on and management has changed, they've stopped treating employees, and patients with respect. My hope is that in time, they find upper management who truly care for our community, and not their own pockets.
cons: Not friendly, not accommodating, ageist, do not respect or care for seniority, low pay, minimal raises, do not support employees in finding alternate jobs in the company when they removed a job title due to contractual changes, do not support or care for the Physicians, rude to clients who speak a different language, unfair to new employees.

review_title: Nice people, but low expectations for employees.
pros: CFO is great. She makes it a point to motivate her staff. A lot of people have worked there for 5 or more years.
cons: Those that have been there for 5 or more years lack motivation because there is no room for advancement. They do not like to promote from within they would rather hire outside because of office politics. Even the worst employees will not get fired because of the union.

pros: Great benefits package! Great providers! Great co-workers!
cons: Some of the people in management positions should not be there and some of those same managers are petty and do nothing more than hold others down.
